Package cps.mouradalpha

Class DCVMBasic

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.cvm.AbstractCVM
      • fr.sorbonne_u.components.cvm.AbstractDistributedCVM
        • cps.mouradalpha.DCVMBasic
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.cvm.ComponentVirtualMachineI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.cvm.DistributedComponentVirtualMachineI
    public class DCVMBasic
extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.cvm.AbstractDistributedCVM
    The class AbstractDistributedCVM implements the multi-JVM assembly for our project, in this example we have two JVMs, one of them has a broker and a publisher, the other one has a broker and subscriber. Both of brokers are connected so that the subscriber can subscribe for topics created by the publisher and get notify when there is a message published.
    Author:
    Alpha Issiaga DIALLO / Mourad TOUATI

      static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)  
      void shutdown()
      shut down the CVM, synchronising with the other JVM when distributed, i.e. all of the deployed components in the CVM are shut down; inspired from the Java Executor framework.
